title: What is the range on the new assassin mastery?
body: Does anyone know how many units you have to be from allies for this to proc?

replies.body: 800 units, so it's not a great choice in a duo lane, but should get some use in team fights if you're diving at least a moderate distance in front of your team.

{{champion:80}} {{champion:121}} are in a pretty bad spot as junglers right now. They need to go 3 cookies just to be healthy enough through their first run to not be susceptible to invades and be able to gank early. I feel like this mastery won't be better because of how much the cookies help them early. Any plans on helping these two? I enjoy playing them and they're iconic junglers... but right now they are struggling as hell.

As Panth you shouldn't be having that much health problems.
Creep kite, use more q's to get his passive up, block more attacks from large monster, focus correct monsters, rotate camps better (he usually doesn't go krug/red/blue or gromp/blue/red like most junglers)
Can't say about kha, don't play him...but defiantly panth, if you're low on health just jungling..you're doing something incorrectly. I've used 0/18/12 and 18/12/0 on him and not getting Secret Stash on either. Still enough health to keep jungling or gank without recalling till I need to buy something worth recalling to buy..

it seems a pretty great choice for sololanes.

Does it increase damage to non-champions? If so, then cunning tier one is a hard choice for junglers.

>
> 800 units

I think you mean ~8 Teemos.
how much do you think it will be powerful while in solo lanes? It applies to champions only or also to minions kha' zix like?

Allied champions only, so will be useful in solo lanes. It's not a particularly powerful effect, that's because of the tier it's at though. The power budget for Tier 1 keystones is quite low, hence the other options being things like biscuits or longer jungle buffs.
Very well, thanks for the reply :)
HAHAHA 800 units! i always said "about 2 flash ranges" which should be exactly 800 units

It is not that strong a mastery, so I wouldn't force things too much to have it active as much as possible. 
It adds something like 8 dmg on a 400-500 dmg combo at lv. 6, 30 dmg on a 2.000 dmg squishy-busting late game: that is, nothing so noticeable to be worth modifying your positioning.

Its sense, imho, is giving something instead of nothing for non-junglers that invest in the Cunning tree at the tier 1 keystone and don't need cookies. But it's still a meager something.
